meanings.definition: To not be equal or similar to something else.
meanings.sent1: The two socks unmatch in color.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle pieces unmatch in size.
meanings.sent3: It was quite funny to see the twins unmatch in height.
meanings.sent4: The two teams unmatch in skill level.
meanings.sent5: The flavors of the ice cream unmatch perfectly.

meanings.definition: To remove a match or pairing.
meanings.sent1: She had to unmatch the socks before washing them.
meanings.sent2: He decided to unmatch the curtains from the furniture.
meanings.sent3: The magician unmatch the cards in a surprising trick.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to unmatch the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: The computer program can unmatch the data efficiently.

meanings.definition: To not find a match or equal.
meanings.sent1: The missing shoe unmatch with its pair.
meanings.sent2: The lonely glove unmatch with any others.
meanings.sent3: It was frustrating to unmatch the key to the lock.
meanings.sent4: The unique pattern unmatch with any others in the collection.
meanings.sent5: The rare gemstone unmatch with any in the jeweler's inventory.
